thread.title: 'Smart palm trees' in Dubai offer WiFi and power at the beach
thread.title_full: 'Smart palm trees' in Dubai offer WiFi and power at the beach | Daily Mail Online

author: Katie Amey
title: 'Smart palm trees' in Dubai offer WiFi and power at the beach
text:
View
comments
Smart palm trees have been installed and are ready for use in Dubai this summer enabling beach goers and park visitors to have limitless power and internet access on their mobile phones.
Soaking up the sun during the day, these state-of-the-art trees store energy to be discharged in the evening.
On each tree, there are eight charging points and WiFi ranges for 100 metres in any direction.
Smart palm: At night the trees discharge energy and WiFi for 100 metres
One of the first Smart Palm trees has been installed on the beach front near to the Burj Al Arab in Dubai
Smart Palm is the company behind this ingenious endeavour and have so far set up two - one on Surf Beach and another in a park near the waterfront.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 2 Next Veil of secrecy over plans for Shanghai Disneyland is... Chinese man treats his pet sea lion to the ultimate birthday... It's one way to stay warm in the Arctic Circle: Inside the... The company plans to plant them in 103 locations around Dubai as part of a contract with the city.
Towering at 20 feet high and with leaves measuring 18 square metres, the high-tech palms, understandably, are also equipped with screens and security cameras.
UAE sun: Solar panels soak up energy during the day at the Smart Palm installed at the Dubai park
The ceremony launching the Smart Palms was well attended by UAE locals
'For us, it was important to translate the important cultural identity of the date palm from being a plant that provided shelter, building materials, shade and sustenance, to our Smart Palm, designed to provide data, connectivity, energy and all in a sustainable manner,' says Viktor Nelepa, Smart Palm's founder, in a press release.
However, the cost to use the powerful palm has not yet been decided.
Locals gather around the Smart Palm on Burj Al Arab which has eight charging points
Smart Palm tree launched the new technology in a special ceremony in Dubai
And while they may be useful to sneak some shade under during the day, it's at night that passersby will undoubtedly flock.
Best of all? The company insists that the trees can charge your batteries two and a half times faster than your home charger.
Perfect for a night out on the town.
Night life: Beach goers flock to see the new arrival on the Surf Beach
